Description: Ensures 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain' are complete and valid.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that email configuration exists with valid send_from_domain and reply_to_domain settings for candidate communications.

**Impact:** Without email configuration, recruiters cannot send emails to candidates from the platform.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Provisioning → Email & SMS Configuration. Configure send_from_domain and reply_to_domain with verified domains.
Updates to rule logic: Instead of checking if the email_config has object or not, we should check for 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain'

Rule Name: The user has permission to send messages but does not have a communication email set
Config Reference: User Management → users with PERM_SEND_MESSAGES / communication_email
Description: The rule checks for users with send email permission who do not have a communication email set.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Identifies users with send_messages permission who don't have a communication email configured.

**Impact:** Users without communication email cannot send messages to candidates, blocking engagement.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Provisioning → Manage Users. Add communication_email for all users with PERM_SEND_MESSAGES.

Description: Ensures that SMS integration is enabled with valid provider configuration (Twilio, etc.). SMS provider credentials and phone number must be configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that SMS integration is configured with Twilio credentials for candidate text messaging.

**Impact:** Without SMS configuration, recruiters cannot send text messages to candidates.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Provisioning → Email & SMS Config. Configure Twilio account SID, auth token, and phone number.

Description: Verifies that communication channels (sms, whatsapp) are configured for interview scheduling.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that communication channels (SMS, WhatsApp) are configured for interview scheduling notifications.

**Impact:** Missing channels limit notification options if candidates prefer non-email communication.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling. Enable SMS and WhatsApp channels as needed.
Updates to rule logic: Rule needs to take into account customers that have NOT enabled other communication channels (SMS or Whatsapp). Phase 1 - feature alignment Phase 2 - rule logic update

Description: Ensures that WhatsApp Business API integration is configured with provider credentials and phone number.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that WhatsApp Business API integration is configured for candidate messaging via WhatsApp.

**Impact:** Without WhatsApp configuration, recruiters cannot communicate with candidates via WhatsApp, which is preferred in many regions.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Provisioning → Email & SMS Config. Configure WhatsApp Twilio account SID, auth token, and messaging service ID.

Rule Name: All job req templates should be present in template_to_stage_transition_map
Description: Validates that all job requisition template IDs are included in the stage transition map.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that all job requisition template IDs are included in the stage transition map, ensuring stage advances work across all position types.

**Impact:** Missing templates cause stage advance failures, preventing candidates from progressing in the pipeline.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Workflows. Ensure all job_req_template_ids are in template_to_stage_transition_map.

Description: This rule verifies the presence of the Leads Workflow tab in the pipeline page.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the Leads Workflow tab is configured on the pipeline page, providing access to sourced/matched candidates.

**Impact:** Missing Leads tab prevents recruiters from accessing the candidate sourcing workflow.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Pipeline & Workflows. Enable leads tab in workflow_config.

Description: This rule verifies the presence of the Applicant Workflow tab on the pipeline page.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the Applicants Workflow tab is configured on the pipeline page for viewing applied candidates.

**Impact:** Missing Applicants tab prevents recruiters from viewing and managing job applicants.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Pipeline & Workflows. Enable applicants tab in workflow_config.
Updates to rule logic: With this rule, would it be possible to run a report on against the current configuration to identify the base requirements (ie Contacted, Applicants flows are missing) Phase 1 - Description

Rule Name: Successful Application Stage Advances Per Job Req Template
Config Reference: Operational metrics → stage advance success rate (90% target)
Description: Every job req template should have at least a 90% success rate with stage advances.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Measures the success rate of stage advances per job requisition template. Target: 90%+ success rate.

**Impact:** Low success rate indicates stage transition map issues causing ATS sync failures.

**To Fix:** Review stage transition map for failing templates. Verify stage mapping to ATS. Check ATS API connectivity.

Description: Ensures that key profile sections are defined and enabled. At minimum, overview section should be present.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that key profile sections are enabled for displaying candidate information to recruiters (Overview, Experience, Education, Skills).

**Impact:** Missing sections prevent recruiters from viewing important candidate information.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Profile Display Config. Enable required sections.

Description: Ensures that specific Copilot capabilities (job description generation, scheduling assistance, etc.) are enabled in capability configuration.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that specific Copilot capabilities are enabled (e.g., job description generation, scheduling assistant).

**Impact:** Without capability configuration, Copilot is enabled but has no functional features.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Copilot Capability Config. Enable desired capabilities.

Description: Ensures that Copilot feature is enabled in configuration. Copilot must be explicitly enabled before use.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that Copilot AI features are enabled for recruiters and hiring managers.

**Impact:** Without Copilot, AI-powered features like job description generation are unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Copilot Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that diversity configuration object exists. This config controls bias reduction features like profile masking.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that diversity configuration exists, which is required for enabling profile masking and bias reduction features.

**Impact:** Without configuration, diversity and bias reduction features cannot be activated.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Diversity Config. Initialize configuration and enable desired features.

Description: Ensures that if profile masking is enabled, specific fields are configured to be masked (age, gender, ethnicity, etc.).
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that when profile masking is enabled, specific fields are configured for masking (e.g., name, age, gender, photos).

**Impact:** Masking enabled without field specification means no fields are actually hidden, defeating the purpose.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Diversity Config → Masking. Specify fields to mask in masking_config.

Description: Ensures that anonymization rules are correctly configured to automatically anonymize candidate profiles based on defined criteria.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that anonymization rules are defined with specific criteria for removing identifying information from candidate profiles during bias-conscious workflows.

**Impact:** Without clear anonymization rules, profile masking may not adequately remove identifying information, defeating the purpose.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Diversity Config → Anonymization. Configure rules for each masked field with clear criteria.

Description: Ensures that global search feature is enabled in configuration, allowing recruiters to search across the talent network.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that global search is enabled for recruiters to search across the entire talent network.

**Impact:** Without global search, recruiters cannot effectively find candidates across all sources.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Global Search Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that search filters are configured, allowing recruiters to refine searches by location, skills, experience, contact_consent etc.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that search filters are configured for global talent search (skills, location, experience, etc.).

**Impact:** Without filters, recruiters cannot effectively narrow down candidate search results.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Global Search Config. Configure filters for skills, location, experience, contact consent.
Updates to rule logic: This should be kept added contact_consent to description. Phase 1 - Description

Description: Defines the columns, display names, fields, formatting, and widths for the consolidated feedback report.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that feedback report columns are configured for consolidated interview feedback viewing.

**Impact:** Misconfigured reports affect how recruiters and hiring managers review interview feedback.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Interview Feedback. Configure report columns and formatting.

Description: Configures the list of columns displayed on the feedback dashboard to provide relevant and actionable information to users.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that feedback dashboard columns are configured for the Interview Feedback Center.

**Impact:** Missing columns reduce dashboard usefulness for managing feedback across interviews.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Interview Feedback. Configure dashboard_columns_list.

Description: Ensures that feedback form templates are configured. Forms define the structure and questions for interview feedback.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that at least one interview feedback form template exists with questions for interviewers to provide structured feedback.

**Impact:** Without form templates, interviewers cannot submit structured feedback through the platform.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Interview Feedback. Create at least one feedback form template with rating scales and open-ended questions.

Description: Ensures that interview feedback feature is configured and enabled, allowing interviewers to submit structured feedback.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that interview feedback feature is enabled for collecting structured interviewer feedback.

**Impact:** Without enablement, interview feedback cannot be collected through the platform.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Interview Feedback Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures a default interview timezone is configured for scenarios where user-defined or calendar-specific timezones are unavailable.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a default timezone is configured for interview scheduling to prevent time confusion.

**Impact:** Missing timezone can cause scheduling errors and incorrect time display.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling. Set default timezone.

Description: Ensures the scheduling action is enabled on the profile or pipeline page, allowing recruiters to initiate interview scheduling directly.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the scheduling action button is enabled on pipeline and profile pages.

**Impact:** Without the action, recruiters cannot initiate interview scheduling from the candidate context.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling. Enable schedule action in pipeline configuration.

Description: Ensures that calendar integration is configured with provider credentials. Integration is required for checking availability and creating calendar events.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that calendar integration is configured for interview scheduling, enabling automatic availability checking and calendar event creation.

**Impact:** Without calendar integration, interviewers cannot have their availability checked automatically.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling Config. Select calendar provider (Google/Microsoft) and complete OAuth configuration.
Updates to rule logic: Calendar integration doesnt require any specific setup with regards to Provider credentials. Global Rules should include checks on Branding Config, Company Name, Calendar Provider, Availability, Preferences

Description: Ensures that filters in the Scheduling Center (hiring manager, location, etc.) have appropriate facet limits and autocomplete configurations.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that scheduling center filters have appropriate maximum values (facet_limit) to prevent overwhelming filter options.

**Impact:** Without limits, filters may show too many options, making the interface difficult to use.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling Config → Filters. Set appropriate facet_limit values for each filter.
Updates to rule logic: For this functionality, EF has default configuration that most customers are happy with

Description: Ensures that scheduling templates are configured, defining interview types, durations, and participant roles.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that at least one scheduling template exists defining interview structure (type, duration, participants).

**Impact:** Without templates, interviews cannot be scheduled as there's no defined structure.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling Templates. Create templates with duration, interview type, and participant roles.

Description: Ensures that role permissions for scheduling templates are correctly configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job requisition template permissions are properly configured, controlling who can use which templates.

**Impact:** Incorrect permissions may prevent users from creating requisitions or allow unauthorized template access.

**To Fix:** Review template permissions. Ensure appropriate users/roles have access to relevant templates.

Description: Ensures that smart scheduling feature is configured and enabled, allowing automated interview scheduling.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that smart scheduling feature is enabled for interview scheduling functionality.

**Impact:** Without enablement, interview scheduling features are completely unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures a calendar provider (e.g., Google Calendar, Microsoft Outlook 365) is configured to enable seamless interview scheduling.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a calendar provider is configured for interview scheduling integration.

**Impact:** Without calendar provider, interviews cannot be synchronized with calendars.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Scheduling. Configure calendarProvider (Google Calendar, Microsoft 365).

Description: Ensures that workflow automation feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of automated candidate workflows.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that workflow automation feature is enabled for creating automated candidate workflows.

**Impact:** Without enablement, automated workflows cannot be created or executed.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Workflow Automation Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that at least one workflow trigger is configured. Triggers define when workflows execute (stage change, application, etc.).
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that at least one workflow trigger is configured with valid events and conditions for automation.

**Impact:** Without triggers, automated workflows cannot execute as there's no defined trigger condition.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Workflows. Configure at least one trigger with event type (stage change, application, etc.) and conditions.

Description: Configures a clear and actionable message displayed when the Communities feature is disabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a clear message is configured when Communities feature is disabled in the Chrome Extension.

**Impact:** Without clear messaging, extension users may be confused about feature unavailability.

**To Fix:** Configure descriptive disabled text explaining why Communities is unavailable and how to enable.

Description: Ensures that reminders set by users on a candidate's profile are visible across all platforms, including the EF extension.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that reminder functionality is configured in the Chrome Extension for team-wide candidate reminder visibility.

**Impact:** Without reminders, team members may duplicate outreach efforts or miss follow-ups.

**To Fix:** Configure reminder_action in extension configuration to enable team-wide reminder visibility.

Description: Ensures that the hostname is set in the app_configs section of extension config for linkedin, naukri and github.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that hostname configurations are set for LinkedIn, Naukri, and GitHub in the Chrome Extension.

**Impact:** Missing hostname configuration prevents profile parsing from these job sites.

**To Fix:** Configure app_configs with correct hostnames for each supported site in extension settings.

Description: Ensures that all actions and sub-actions are correctly set up so recruiters and sourcers have a smooth, intuitive experience managing candidates.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that all extension actions (save candidate, mark status, set reminder) are properly configured.

**Impact:** Missing or misconfigured actions prevent recruiters from managing candidates through the extension.

**To Fix:** Configure all actions and sub-actions in extension configuration for complete candidate management.

Description: Ensures that event recruiting feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of recruiting events.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that event recruiting is enabled, allowing creation and management of recruiting events (career fairs, info sessions, etc.).

**Impact:** Without enablement, event recruiting features are completely unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Event Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that event-specific pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress through event recruiting.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that event-specific pipeline stages (Registered, Attended, Interviewed, etc.) are configured for candidate tracking.

**Impact:** Without stages, candidates in events cannot be progressed through event workflows.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Event Workflow Config. Define event stages with appropriate actions.

Description: Ensures that event home configuration is set up, controlling how events are displayed and listed in the UI.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the Event Home page is properly configured with display settings for the events list.

**Impact:** Invalid configuration may cause the events list to display incorrectly or not at all.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Event Home Config. Configure columns, filters, and display settings.

Description: Ensures that when assessment requests fail and candidates are moved to Assessment Error stage, the error message is captured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that assessment integration error messages are properly configured to provide clear feedback when assessment triggers fail.

**Impact:** Without proper error messaging, troubleshooting assessment failures becomes difficult.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Assessment Config. Configure error_messages for common failure scenarios.

Description: Ensures that event assessment triggers are configured to pass all required fields to external assessment systems.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that assessment triggers are fully configured with all required fields including trigger event, assessment type, and conditions.

**Impact:** Incomplete trigger configuration prevents assessments from being sent to candidates automatically.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Assessment Config → Triggers. Ensure each trigger has event type, assessment provider, conditions defined.

Description: Ensures that smart campaigns feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of candidate nurture campaigns.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that smart campaigns feature is enabled for automated candidate nurture workflows.

**Impact:** Without enablement, automated campaign features for candidate engagement are unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Campaign Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that email templates specific to campaigns are configured for candidate outreach.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that email templates exist for use in smart campaigns, enabling automated candidate nurture sequences.

**Impact:** Without campaign templates, smart campaigns cannot send automated emails to candidates.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Email Templates. Create templates and tag them for campaign use. Include merge fields for personalization.
Updates to rule logic: System should check for at least 1 associated campaign template is configured in the system

Description: Ensures that talent communities feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of talent pools.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that talent communities feature is enabled for managing talent pools and prospect engagement.

**Impact:** Without enablement, talent community features for nurturing prospects are unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Community Home Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that community pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress within talent communities.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that pipeline stages are configured for talent communities, enabling progression tracking for community members.

**Impact:** Without stages, community members cannot be tracked through engagement workflows.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Community Workflow Config. Define stages (e.g., New, Engaged, Nurtured, Applied).

Description: This rule verifies that the Community Home page is correctly configured by ensuring the presence and validity of key objects.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that Community Home configuration is complete with available_filters, filter_to_fq_data_map, and columns for the dashboard.

**Impact:** Missing configuration causes the Community Home page to be non-functional or display incorrectly.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Communities. Configure available_filters, filter_to_fq_data_map, and columns.
Updates to rule logic: Currently, the rule only checks if the available_filters is not empty or null. But it should also check for filter_to_fq_data_map and columns Phase 1 - Description Phase 2 - logic update

Description: Verifies that community_workflow_config is defined per community type with a valid display_name and non-empty workflow steps.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that community_workflow_config is defined per community type with valid display_name and workflow steps.

**Impact:** Without workflow configuration, communities cannot progress prospects through engagement stages.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Acquisition → Community Workflow Config. Define workflows with stages for each community type.

Description: This rule checks if recaptcha_enabled is set to true. This ensures that only real users can submit applications in PCS.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that reCAPTCHA is enabled on the career site to prevent bot submissions and spam applications.

**Impact:** Without reCAPTCHA, bots can submit fake applications, polluting the candidate database and wasting recruiter time.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Security. Set recaptcha_enabled: true.

Description: This rule checks if a privacy policy is configured in PCS.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a privacy policy is configured and displayed on the career site for GDPR/CCPA compliance.

**Impact:** Without privacy policy, the career site may not be compliant with privacy regulations.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Privacy. Configure privacy policy URL or content.

Description: Ensures that company logo is uploaded and configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the company logo is uploaded for the career site, ensuring proper brand representation.

**Impact:** Without a logo, the career site displays without company branding, reducing recognition and trust.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Upload logo image (recommended: PNG with transparent background, minimum 200x50 pixels).

Description: This rule checks if customer domain is white labeled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a custom domain alias is configured for the career site (e.g., careers.company.com).

**Impact:** Without white-label domain, career site uses Eightfold default domain, reducing brand trust.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Domain Config. Configure custom domain and verify DNS CNAME record.

Description: Ensures that brand colors are configured with valid hex color codes.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that brand colors are configured with valid hex codes for the career site, ensuring consistent brand representation.

**Impact:** Without brand colors, the career site uses default colors instead of company branding, reducing brand recognition.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Set primary_color and secondary_color in hex format (e.g., #146da6).

Description: Ensures that mobile-specific configurations are correctly defined.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that mobile-specific configurations are defined for the career site, ensuring proper display on mobile devices.

**Impact:** Without mobile configuration, the career site may not display correctly on phones and tablets.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config. Configure device_configuration settings for mobile display.

Description: Ensures a valid company name is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a valid company name is configured for display on the career site and email communications.

**Impact:** Missing or generic company name reduces professional appearance and candidate trust.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Set the company name field.

Description: Confirms a company logo is uploaded to the navigation bar.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a logo is displayed in the navigation bar for consistent branding across all career site pages.

**Impact:** Missing navbar logo reduces brand visibility and professional appearance.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Upload navigation bar logo.

Description: This rule checks if favicons are configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a favicon is configured for the career site browser tab and bookmarks.

**Impact:** Missing favicon displays generic browser icon, reducing brand recognition in bookmarks and tabs.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Upload favicon (recommended: 32x32 or 48x48 ICO/PNG).

Description: This rule ensures a company logo URL is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a company logo URL is configured for social sharing previews (Open Graph) on the career site.

**Impact:** Without logo URL, link previews on LinkedIn/Facebook show generic images, reducing click-through rates.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Branding Config. Set company logo URL for social sharing.

Description: Ensures that PCS base configuration is present and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that PCS (Personalized Career Site) base configuration is enabled, which is the foundation for all career site functionality.

**Impact:** Without base configuration enabled, the career site is completely inaccessible to candidates.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Career Site & Referrals. Set enabled: true in pcsx_base_config.

Description: Ensures that application form configuration exists.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the job application form is configured with the required and optional fields for candidates to submit applications.

**Impact:** Without application form configuration, candidates cannot apply to positions on the career site.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Career Site & Referrals → Apply Form. Configure required fields (name, email, resume) and optional fields (phone, cover letter).

Rule Name: Careerhub Logged In Candidate Max Resume Size Bytes
Description: Ensures the maximum allowed size for resume uploads is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that resume upload size limits are configured for logged-in candidates on the career site.

**Impact:** Without size limits, large file uploads may fail or exceed ATS limits, causing application errors.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config. Set max_resume_size_bytes (recommended: 20MB or 20971520 bytes).

Description: Ensures that login and signup configuration is valid.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that login and signup configuration is defined, specifying authentication methods and required fields for candidate accounts.

**Impact:** Without configuration, candidates cannot create accounts or log in to the career site.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Login Signup Config. Configure authentication method (email/social) and required fields.

Description: Ensures that profile fields are defined.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that candidate profile fields are defined (name, email, phone, experience, education, skills) for profile creation.

**Impact:** Without field configuration, candidates cannot create complete profiles, affecting match quality.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Candidate Profile Config. Define profile fields and mark which are required/optional.

Description: Ensures that candidate profile configuration is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that candidate profile functionality is enabled, allowing candidates to create and maintain living profiles.

**Impact:** Without profile configuration, candidates cannot save their information for future applications.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Candidate Profile Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: This rule ensures that login functionality is enabled for candidates.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that candidate login is enabled, providing personalized job recommendations and application tracking.

**Impact:** Without login, candidates have no personalized experience and cannot track applications.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config. Enable candidate login functionality.
Current Feature Name: Logged in PCS (with COP and Job Notifications)

Rule Name: Career Site dashboard should be provisioned
Description: Ensures the Career Site Dashboard is provisioned.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that career site analytics dashboards are provisioned for tracking job views, applications, and site performance.

**Impact:** Without dashboards, there's no visibility into career site performance and candidate behavior.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Provisioning → Dashboards. Provision career site analytics dashboards.

Description: Ensures that candidate-facing copilot (chatbot) is configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the candidate-facing Copilot (AI assistant) is enabled to help candidates with job search and application questions.

**Impact:** Without Copilot, candidates don't have AI-powered assistance on the career site, reducing self-service capabilities.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Chatbot Config. Set enabled: true and configure greeting message.

Description: Ensures that custom domain is configured with valid domain name format.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that a custom domain (e.g., careers.company.com) is configured for the career site instead of the default Eightfold subdomain.

**Impact:** Without custom domain, the career site URL includes the Eightfold domain, which may not align with company branding.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Domain Config. Configure custom domain and add the required DNS CNAME record.

Description: Ensures that SSL certificate is present and valid.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that SSL certificate is valid, not expired, and properly configured for secure HTTPS access.

**Impact:** SSL issues cause security warnings or block access to the career site entirely.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Domain Config. Check certificate expiration. Upload new certificate if needed.

Description: Ensures that job alerts are configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job alerts are enabled, allowing candidates to receive personalized job recommendations via email.

**Impact:** Without job alerts, candidates don't receive notifications about new matching jobs, reducing engagement.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Notification Config. Enable job alerts and configure frequency options.

Description: Ensures that job alert frequency settings are configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job alert frequency options are configured for candidates, allowing them to choose how often they receive job recommendations.

**Impact:** Without frequency configuration, candidates may receive too many or too few notifications, impacting engagement.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Candidate Notifications Config. Configure frequency options (daily, weekly, biweekly) with appropriate default.

Description: Ensures that job feed configuration is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job feed generation is enabled for distributing jobs to external job boards and search engines.

**Impact:** Without job feed, jobs are not distributed to Indeed, LinkedIn, Glassdoor, or indexed by Google for Jobs.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Job Feed Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that SEO configuration is valid.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that SEO configuration is set up with meta tags, structured data, and sitemap for search engine visibility.

**Impact:** Poor SEO configuration reduces career site visibility in search engine results.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → SEO. Configure title templates, meta descriptions, structured data, and sitemap.

Description: This rule checks if XML feeds are enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that XML job feeds are enabled for distribution to major job boards like Indeed and LinkedIn.

**Impact:** Without XML feeds, jobs are not visible on major job boards, significantly reducing application volume.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Job Feed Config. Enable XML feeds for desired job boards.

Description: At least one position is displayed in PCS.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that at least one position is configured to display on the career site.

**Impact:** Without positions, candidates see an empty career site with no jobs to apply for.

**To Fix:** Verify position sync from ATS. Check position filter query (fq) configuration. Ensure positions have display_on_career_site flag.

Description: Ensures that search configuration is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job search functionality is configured on the career site.

**Impact:** Without search configuration, candidates cannot find jobs on the career site.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Search. Configure search settings including filters and display options.

Description: Ensures that job search filters are configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that job search filters are configured on the career site (location, department, job type, etc.).

**Impact:** Without filters, candidates can search but cannot refine results, leading to poor user experience.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Search. Configure filters for location, department, job type.

Description: Confirms PCS is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the Personalized Career Site (PCS) is enabled for candidates.

**Impact:** Without PCS enabled, candidates cannot access the career site at all.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config. Set enabled: true.

Description: This rule checks if Talent Network is set up.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that Talent Network is configured, allowing candidates to join the talent pool without applying to specific positions.

**Impact:** Without Talent Network, passive candidates cannot express interest, limiting talent pool growth.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Enable and configure Talent Network.

Description: Ensures that talent network join feature is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that Talent Network join is enabled, allowing candidates to join the talent pool without applying to a specific position.

**Impact:** Without enablement, talent pool growth is limited to only active applicants.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Enable talent network join option (enableTalentNetwork: true).

Description: Ensures that talent network join form is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the Talent Network join form is configured with appropriate fields for candidates joining without applying to specific positions.

**Impact:** Without form configuration, candidates cannot join the talent network, limiting talent pool growth.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config → Talent Network. Configure form fields (name, email, phone, interests).

Description: Ensures that landing page configuration is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that landing page configuration is initialized, enabling creation of custom landing pages for campaigns.

**Impact:** Without configuration, custom landing pages cannot be created for targeted recruitment campaigns.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Landing Config. Initialize configuration.

Description: Ensures that landing pages have valid URLs configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that landing page URLs are valid and accessible, ensuring candidates can reach campaign-specific pages.

**Impact:** Invalid URLs cause landing pages to be inaccessible, breaking campaign links.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Landing Config. Verify all URL paths are valid and test accessibility.

Description: Ensures that each microsite has complete configuration.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that each microsite has complete configuration including branding, domain mapping, job filters, and content.

**Impact:** Incomplete configuration causes microsites to display incorrectly or show wrong job listings.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Microsites. Complete all configuration sections for each microsite.

Description: Ensures that candidate login sessions and profiles are isolated between microsites.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that candidate profiles and applications are properly isolated between the parent career site and microsites when required.

**Impact:** Without proper isolation, candidate data may leak between sites or candidates may need to re-register.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Microsites. Configure profile_isolation and application_isolation settings.

Rule Name: People You May Work With Enabled
Description: Ensures that People You May Work With feature is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that "People You May Work With" feature is enabled on job detail pages, showing potential colleagues.

**Impact:** Without PYMWW, candidates don't see potential team members, reducing engagement and conversion.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Position Details → Sections. Enable pymww_config section.

Description: Configures selection criteria for People You May Work With.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that PYMWW (People You May Work With) selection criteria are configured to determine which employees are shown.

**Impact:** Without selection criteria, PYMWW may show irrelevant employees or none at all.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Position Details → PYMWW. Add filter query (fq) for employee selection.

Description: Ensures that tracking scripts have valid JavaScript syntax.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that tracking scripts (Google Analytics, pixel tags) have valid JavaScript syntax and are assigned to correct events.

**Impact:** Invalid scripts cause tracking failures, creating gaps in analytics data.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Tracking Pixel Config. Validate JavaScript syntax. Test tracking in browser developer tools.

Rule Name: PCS and TA Match Score Consistency
Description: Ensures that match scores displayed to candidates match recruiter view.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that match score thresholds and algorithms are consistent between the career site (PCS) and Talent Acquisition modules.

**Impact:** Inconsistent scoring can confuse candidates (seeing different match levels) and affect recruiter trust in AI matching.

**To Fix:** Review strong_match_threshold in both PCS and TA configurations. Ensure algorithm versions and thresholds are aligned.

Description: Ensures that Linkoff is configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that link-off configuration is enabled when redirecting candidates to an external ATS for application completion.

**Impact:** Without link-off enabled, candidates cannot be redirected to external application systems.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Apply Form → Link Off. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that Linkoff redirect URL is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that when link-off (redirect to external ATS) is enabled, the redirect URL is configured.

**Impact:** Missing redirect URL causes candidates to be unable to complete applications.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Apply Form → Link Off. Add apply_redirect_url with the correct ATS application URL pattern.

Description: Ensures that Smart Apply is configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that Smart Apply is enabled for one-click applications with ATS integration.

**Impact:** Without Smart Apply, applications require more steps and may not sync properly to the ATS.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Set enabled: true and configure ATS integration.

Description: Ensures that field mappings are complete.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that all required application fields are mapped between Eightfold and the ATS for successful application sync.

**Impact:** Incomplete field mapping causes application data to be incomplete or missing in the ATS.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config → Field Mapping. Map all required fields (name, email, resume, phone, etc.).

Description: This rule ensures the maximum resume upload size is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that resume upload size limits are configured and aligned with ATS limits to prevent upload failures.

**Impact:** Size limits higher than ATS can cause applications accepted by PCS but rejected by ATS. Limits too low block valid resumes.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config. Set max_resume_size_bytes matching ATS limits (default: 20MB).

Description: This rule checks if question deduplication is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that question deduplication is enabled for candidates applying to multiple positions, streamlining the application experience.

**Impact:** Without deduplication, candidates see repeated questions when applying to multiple jobs, increasing drop-off rates.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Set dedup_pos_questions: true.

Description: This rule checks if resume upload is required before apply.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that resume upload is required before application submission to ensure complete candidate profiles.

**Impact:** Without requirement, candidates can submit applications without resumes, reducing profile quality.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Set upload_resume_before_apply: true.

Description: This rule ensures strong_match_threshold is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that strong_match_threshold is configured for job matching display. This prevents poorly matched candidates from being shown.

**Impact:** Without threshold, irrelevant matches may be displayed, reducing quality of candidate and recruiter experience.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Search. Configure strong_match_threshold.

Description: This rule checks if source IDs are configured correctly.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that application source IDs are correctly configured for tracking candidate origins.

**Impact:** Invalid source IDs cause source attribution failures, breaking recruitment analytics.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Verify source IDs in referrer_src_map and add_application_sources.

Description: Ensures that smart referral feature is configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that smart referral feature is enabled for employee referrals with AI matching.

**Impact:** Without enablement, employee referral functionality with AI matching is unavailable.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config. Enable referrals.

Description: Ensures that referral workflow is configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the referral workflow is fully configured with submission form, tracking stages, and notifications.

**Impact:** Without workflow configuration, the employee referral process is incomplete or non-functional.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config → Referrals. Configure submission form, tracking, and notifications.

Description: Ensures that source tracking parameters are configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that source tracking parameters (UTM codes, referral sources) are configured for attribution.

**Impact:** Without parameter configuration, candidate sources are not captured correctly.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Source Map Config. Configure UTM parameter mapping and source codes.

Description: Ensures that source tracking is configured and enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that source tracking is enabled for capturing where candidates come from (job boards, campaigns, referrals).

**Impact:** Without source tracking, recruitment marketing effectiveness cannot be measured.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Source Tracking. Set enabled: true.

Description: Ensures that source tracking data is mapped to sync with ATS.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that source tracking data is mapped to sync with applications to the ATS.

**Impact:** Without source sync, source attribution data is lost when applications sync to the ATS.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → Smart Apply Config → Source Mapping. Map source field to ATS source field.

Description: Ensures that withdraw application feature is enabled.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that application withdrawal is enabled, allowing candidates to withdraw their applications.

**Impact:** Without withdrawal capability, candidates cannot remove applications, which may be required for compliance.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Applications. Enable withdraw option.

Description: Ensures that withdraw workflow is properly configured.
Cursor Generated Description:
**Purpose:** Validates that the withdrawal workflow includes confirmation dialog, ATS sync, and candidate notification.

**Impact:** Incomplete workflow may cause withdrawals to not sync to ATS or candidates to not receive confirmation.

**To Fix:** Navigate to Admin Console → Talent Experience → PCS Config → Applications → Withdraw. Configure confirmation and ATS sync.
